p:
Firstly, the Al-Mg system both after 100 turns by HPT and after natural aging shows consistent diffraction peaks for a pure fcc structure, such as 111, 200, 220 and 331, thereby demonstrating a fully Al-based solid solution without any trace of hcp Mg or intermetallic phase. Since the material contains a supersaturation of Mg at room temperature, these results indicate that the mechanically-bonded Al-Mg system ultimately forms a nanostructured metastable
17 alloy in a supersaturated solid solution state of Al after processing by HPT for 100 turns. This compositionally metastable material in a supersaturated solid solution state is maintained stable without any decomposition of a second phase during natural aging for 60 days at room temperature.
